footer.caption: Drugs4Covid++ - AYUDAS FUNDACIÓN BBVA A EQUIPOS DE INVESTIGACIÓN CIENTÍFICA SARS-CoV-2 y COVID-19

home.header: We created a knowledge graph with evidence from scientific publications on coronaviruses. Drugs, diseases, genes and proteins are identified and normalised to enable complex searches on the articles.
home.subheader: Drugs4Covid extracts and structures evidence from scientific papers in five steps: Harvest, Parse, Extract, Integrate, and Publish. Try out our public tools.

section1.title: Harvest
section1.text: Data are collected at this stage. We use reliable information sources to retrieve scientific articles on coronaviruses. The CORD-19 corpus has been the main database used in this study. The latest indexed update is the January 2022 edition, with 334,572 scientific articles and more than 7 million paragraphs.

section2.title: Parse
section2.text: One of the most fundamental text mining tasks in information retrieval in medical domain is the recognition of biomedical entities, such as diseases, chemicals or genes, commonly known as BioNER. As a complement to this recognition, we have linked the detected entities to curated databases in a process called BioNEN entity linking or normalisation.

section3.title: Extract
section3.text: The combined use of natural language processing tasks with word representation techniques and knowledge extraction technologies provides practitioners and clinical researchers with tools that facilitate their work in structuring the information contained in the articles. In particular, to establish relationships between drugs or diseases, and in order to improve corpus searches, we have created representation models based on probabilistic topics capable of abstracting entities from their textual forms and relating them to each other.

section4.title: Integrate
section4.text: In order to address the challenge of integrating biomedical knowledge into a single representation space that also provides traceability, we have created the EBOCA ontology where the Evidence for BiOmedical Concept Association is modelled. The ontology describes and associates concepts from the biomedical domain, as well as the evidence that supports these associations. With this ontology we define the conceptual model on which the Drugs4Covid knowledge graph is built.

section5.title: Publish
section5.text: We have created a hybrid question-answer (QA) system based on natural language that provides answers by combining information from knowledge graphs and text documents. It is a novel KGQA algorithm that works without prior training and without the need to translate the question into a formal query language.

services.title: @:title.services
services.header: This is a list of services available in our webpage

bioNER.title: @:title.bioNLP
bioNER.subtitle: @:bioNLPView.subtitle
bioNER.text: A biomedical named entity recognizer (NER) that normalizes (NEN) the drugs, diseases, genes and proteins mentioned in texts with the codes of the main standardization systems such as MeSH, ICD-10, ATC, SNOMED, ChEBI, GARD and NCBI. It is based on fine-tuning the BioBERT language model independently for each entity type using domain-specific datasets and an inverse index search to normalize the references.

bioSearch.title: @:title.searchEngine
bioSearch.subtitle: @:searchEngineView.subtitle
bioSearch.text: An open web service to exploit the existing scientific literature about coronavirus identifying drugs, diseases and articles and displaying their relations inside the corpus. You can search by ATC code, Generic Name, Disease Name or MESH code.

bioQA.title: @:title.qa
bioQA.subtitle: @:qaView.subtitle
bioQA.text: A novel Question-Answering (QA) system based on natural language questions that is domain-independent and enables the combination of knowledge graphs with unstructured information sources to build the answer. It combines DBPedia and Wikidata with the Drugs4Covid database to provide natural language answers.

rdf.title: RDF
rdf.text: The Drugs4Covid Knowledge Graph uses two declarative mapping languages to transform input data into RDF: the W3C Recommendation R2RML for EBOCA SEM-DISNET, and RML for EBOCA Evidences. Both mappings have been created using Mapeathor ans were materialized using the mapping engine Morph-KGC.

sparql.title: SPARQL
sparql.text: A web interface based on the HELIO framework has been created to access the Drugs4Covid knowledge graph. It enables queries in SPARQL format and manages access to resources through its URIs.

textSearch.title: Text Search
textSearch.text: We exploit the entity recognition models and the probabilistic topic representations of Drugs4Covid to provide a search engine based on biomedical entities. Additional databases have been used to extend the drug information and relate it to other terms.

repository.title: Repository
repository.text: Supported by Solr, we have created indexes for each of the biomedical entities that can provide evidence

code.title: Code
code.text: All resources created on Drugs4Covid are open source and publicly available. We have created an organisation on Github to centralise them. Feel free to use them and leave us feedback to help us keep improving.

notebooks.title: Notebooks
notebooks.text: To facilitate the use of our resources and speed up proof-of-concept testing, we have also created Jupyter notebooks that are openly available

cord19Indexing.title: CORD-19 Indexing
cord19Indexing.description: Clean-up and text preparation tasks for indexing CORD-19 articles in Solr

atcProcessing.title: ATC Processing
atcProcessing.description: Retrieve drug information from the ATC system in Solr

meshProcessing.title: MeSH Processing
meshProcessing.description: Retrieve drug and disease information from the MeSH system in Solr

annotatedCorpus.title: Annotated Corpus
annotatedCorpus.text: We have created a biomedical corpus in Spanish with twelve biomedical entities (Disease/Syndrome, Gene, Body Part/Organ, Glucid, Diagnostic Procedure, Protein, Therapeutic Procedure, Symptom/Sign, Pharmacological Substance, Lipid, Organism and Organic Chemical), one linguistic entity (Abbreviation/Sigla/Alias) and seven semantic relations (analyzes, alters, causes, diagnoses, manifestation_of, produces, refers_to, and treats). In total, 200 clinical reports were annotated, and 6636 biomedical entities and 4864 semantic relations were manually identified

textSearch.title: Keyword-guided Resource Finder
textSearch.subtitle: Type one or more keywords and select the resource to retrieve: text, medicine or disease.

bioNLPView.title: @:title.bioNLP
bioNLPView.subtitle: Find the biomedical entities hidden in text
bioNLPView.placeholder: Place some text to start analyzing
bioNLPView.description: BioNER tool which aims to apply last state of the art models for the recognition of Biomedical Entities: Diseases, Chemicals and Genetical ents.

qaView.title: @:title.qa
qaView.subtitle: Make any question to our engine and select the number of answers

searchEngineView.subtitle: Search among all scientific literature about coronavirus
